AN ILLUSTRATED HANDBOOK OF
Tropical Gardening and Planting
With Special Reference to Ceylon,
By H. F. MACMILLAN, F.L.S.,
Superintendent of Botanic Gardens, Ceylon.

About 300 Illustrations. Demy 8vo. 32 Chapters.

ABRIDGED SYNOPSIS:

I. Climate, Soils, &c.
II. Plant-life, nutrition, &c.
III. Manures, natural and artificial
IV. Green-manuring, mulching, inter-cropping, &c.
V. Soil operations: Tillage, rotation of crops, &c.
VI. Propagation; grafting, budding, &c.
VII. Cultural operations: Planting, transplanting, shading, pruning, ring-barking, &c.
VIII. Garden and estate tools and implements.
IX. Laying out gardens: choice of site, preparation of ground, paths, borders, lawns, pot-plants, verandah gardening, &c.
X. Tropical fruits.
XI. Sub-tropical or Temperate fruits.
XII. Tropical Vegetables or Food-products.
XIII. Sub-Tropical or Temperate Vegetables.
XIV. Spices of the tropics.
XV. Flowering and ornamental foliage trees.
XVI. Selections of foliage and flowering shrubs, climbers, palms, bamboos, &c., for low or medium elevations.
XVII. Selections of pot-plants: Foliage and flowering pot-plants, Orchids, Ferns, &c.
XVIII. Selections for medium or high elevations: Ornamental foliage & flowering trees, &c.
XIX. Sand-binding plants, trees, &c., suited to the sea-side.
XX. Shade trees for parks, field crops, Windbelts, Timber, &c.
XXI. Railway Rest-house and School Gardens; Memorial trees; Plants for Cemeteries &c
XXII. Standard products of Ceylon, Tea, Coconuts, Rubber, Cacao, Rice, Cardamoms, Tobacco, &c.
XXIII. Minor Products of Ceylon (Arecanuts, Annatto, Camphor, Cinchona, Citronella, Coca, Coffee, Cotton, Croton-oil, Kola-nut, Nux-vomica, Palmyrah, Sugar-cane, &c.
XXIV. Miscellaneous Economic Products of the Tropics: Edible products, Drugs, Oils, Dyes, Fibres, Guttahs, Tannins, Vegetable-wax, &c.
XXV. Perfume-yielding plants; honey plants; Ornamental seeds; curious fruits; poisons, &c.
XXVI. Pasture, grazing, fodder plants, Edible Herbs and flowers; medicinal plants.
XXVII. Garden and Estate enemies and friends; weeds, &c.
XXVIII. Insect pests, and termites. Insecticides, Fumigation, &c.
XXIX. Fungus diseases, preventive measures, fungicides. Spraying, &c.
XXX. Transport and packing of plants, seeds, bulbs, flowers, &c. Storing of seeds.
XXXI. Useful references; measuring land, trees, timber, &c. Recipes for jams, jellies, &c.
XXXII. Calendars of work.
